concept.name: implicit grid row creation
concept.explain: Placing an item outside the explicit row tracks makes Grid create implicit rows automatically.

ui.prompt: Move the car to the highlighted bay on row 8. Use an implicit row while keeping it in column 2.
hints: Line 8 is beyond the 7-row explicit template, so Grid creates an implicit row.

entities.baseCss: background: rgba(200, 0, 0, 0.22); outline: 2px dashed rgba(200, 0, 0, 0.8); border-radius: 10px;

concept.name: implicit grid column creation
concept.explain: Placing an item outside explicit columns creates implicit columns on demand.

ui.prompt: Move the car to the highlighted bay on column 8. Keep it on row 4.
hints: Column line 8 extends beyond the explicit 7 columns, creating an implicit column.

entities.baseCss: background: rgba(200, 0, 0, 0.22); outline: 2px dashed rgba(200, 0, 0, 0.8); border-radius: 10px;

concept.name: explicit vs implicit tracks
concept.explain: Explicit tracks are declared with grid-template-columns and grid-template-rows; implicit tracks are created automatically when needed.

ui.prompt: Park in the highlighted bay at row 8 / column 8, then define an explicit 8×8 template on .grid.
hints: Set car position: grid-column: 8 / 9; and grid-row: 8 / 9;
Then declare explicit tracks, for example: grid-template-columns: repeat(8, 60px); grid-template-rows: repeat(8, 60px);

entities.baseCss: background: rgba(200, 0, 0, 0.22); outline: 2px dashed rgba(200, 0, 0, 0.8); border-radius: 10px;
